channel.title: SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine!
channel.description:
SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine! [Screen Shot Below]
How To Install Wine In Ubuntu Linux: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Dapper#How_to_install_Windows_Applications_in_Linux_.28Wine.29
After you have installed that, make sure your C drive is mounted in Linux using the Mount command. I forget how to use it lol so just go to google or something and look up. Sorry.
Any way, once your C drive is mounted. Use the command 'cd' to go to your mounted drive, and then go into program files, then go into scar 2.03, and finally run the command "wine scar.exe"
SCAR then pops up and I tried a small script and it worked!
Script used: [code] program New; begin MoveMouse(5, 5); end. [/code]
Here is the screenshot. (703 kb... sorry I'm too lazy to change to a jpg lol.. plus .png files are clearer so whatever.) http://img172.imageshack.us/img172/9356/screenshotqb2.png
~Ron :D

item.title: SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“bullzeye, post:5, topic:17335”]Uhh Ron, I was gonna say “No shit!” but that’s mean

Nah I’m just kidding, but you didn’t know that you could do this? Hmm I’ll try to figure out how to target windows.[/quote]
A lot of programs don’t work with Wine unless you have added software or use a completely different program to emulate windows. And judging by the comments before your post, a lot of people did not know this was possible.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Well hey, I got MoveMouse(5, 5) to work lol, so that’s the first step.

I just hope Wine will finish it’s emulation. I could wait for that… or I could just download WineX/Cedega. I’ll experiment with it, and post again later. Thankd for the comments.

Read full topic

item.title: SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine!
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

SCAR Works in Ubuntu Linux using Wine! [Screen Shot Below]

How To Install Wine In Ubuntu Linux: http://ubuntuguide.org/wiki/Dapper#How_to_install_Windows_Applications_in_Linux_.28Wine.29

After you have installed that, make sure your C drive is mounted in Linux using the Mount command. I forget how to use it lol so just go to google or something and look up. Sorry.

Any way, once your C drive is mounted. Use the command ‘cd’ to go to your mounted drive, and then go into program files, then go into scar 2.03, and finally run the command “wine scar.exe”

SCAR then pops up and I tried a small script and it worked!

Script used:

program New;
begin
  MoveMouse(5, 5);
end.

Here is the screenshot. (703 kb… sorry I’m too lazy to change to a jpg lol… plus .png files are clearer so whatever.)
http://img172.imageshack.us/img172/9356/screenshotqb2.png

~Ron

Read full topic
